entries.title: Suspect in Spain machete attacks on churches jailed on remand for 'terrorism'
entries.description: A Spanish court ordered Monday, January 30, a Moroccan man accused of killing a verger and seriously injuring a priest to be remanded in custody without bail.

entries.title: Death of Tyre Nichols: The United States is sick of its police
entries.description: The fatal beating by five police officers in Memphis shows that nothing has changed more than two years after the gruesome death of George Floyd in May 2020.

entries.title: Renault-Nissan: Japanese press hails end of an 'inequitable agreement'
entries.description: The agreement between Renault and Nissan is presented as the restoration of an injustice by the Japanese media, which tend to forget that the Japanese manufacturer was saved by the French group in 1999.

entries.title: Renault and Nissan sign near-divorce
entries.description: Pending board approvals, the French carmaker will cut its stake in its Japanese partner from 43% to 15% in a reset of their two-decade-old alliance that will put them on equal footing.

entries.title: Israeli-Palestinian conflict: Top US diplomat calls for 'urgent steps to restore calm'
entries.description: While on a visit to Jerusalem during his Middle East tour, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken addressed the spiraling violence between Israel and Palestinians.

entries.title: France and Australia will supply artillery shells to Ukraine
entries.description: Several thousand 155 mm shells will be manufactured jointly according to the two country's defense ministers.

entries.title: Sunak defends record amidst ethics breaches in UK government
entries.description: The British PM is facing criticism for his handling of scandals involving senior Conservative politicians.

entries.title: With no political solution, Israel ramps up repression
entries.description: The far-right ruling coalition is increasing military and police personnel and punitive measures against the families of Palestinians who carry out attacks.

entries.title: The Musée d'Orsay acquires €43 million Caillebotte painting with help of LVMH
entries.description: The acquisition of 'Partie de bateau,' dated 1877-1878 and considered a national treasure, was made possible by the LVMH group's patronage.

entries.title: Claude Gérard, independent Parisian cinema owner, dies at 77
entries.description: The hands-on owner of the Espace Saint-Michel cinema, who was keen on showcasing world cinema and would keep films running for months, passed away on January 24.

entries.title: Russian diplomacy's anti-Semitic urge
entries.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov is increasingly making nauseating comparisons between Hitler and Zelensky, and between the Nazis and Western democracies.

entries.title: Roberto Saviano: 'Cosa Nostra is part and parcel of Italy'
entries.description: The hold of organized crime on the economy and politics in the country is underestimated, writes the Italian author of 'Gomorra' in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Sending fighter jets no longer 'taboo' for some Kyiv allies
entries.description: Several US and European officials have said in recent days that the door is no longer closed for sending F-16 aircraft to Ukraine.

entries.title: Washington's wait-and-see posture over Israel's new government
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken visits Israel on Monday and the West Bank on Tuesday following days of violence in the region.

entries.title: Covid-19 pandemic still an international emergency, says WHO
entries.description: The World Health Organization's emergency committee said that the pandemic was at a 'transition point'. Almost 40,000 deaths are still reported weekly.

entries.title: Two strikes hit military site in Isfahan and Iranian arms convoy in Syria
entries.description: The first attack was carried out by drones against a complex involved in the production of ballistic missiles. The second, in northern Syria, killed seven people.

entries.title: Ukraine calls IOC 'promoter of war' for opening door to Russian athletes
entries.description: An advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky blasted the International Olympic Committee for considering ways to allow Russian athletes to compete.

entries.title: Azerbaijan suspends embassy in Iran after deadly gunman attack
entries.description: On Friday, January 27, a gunman killed one person and wounded two at the Azerbaijani embassy in Iran. Azerbaijan said that diplomatic ties have not been severed.

entries.title: Pakistan mosque bomb kills at least 27 and wounds scores
entries.description: A suicide bomber attacked a mosque in the northwestern Pakistani city of Peshawar, where some 200 worshippers were present.

entries.title: How and when will the tanks promised to Ukraine be delivered?
entries.description: The tanks need to arrive in time and in sufficient numbers in order to affect the outcome of Russia's invasion.

entries.title: French pension reform: Train traffic to be 'very heavily disrupted' in January 31 strikes
entries.description: Paris metros, national rail service, and some flights are set to be disrupted by strikes against the government's pension reform.

entries.title: World Handball Championship: Beaten by Denmark, France will seek revenge in 2024
entries.description: Les Bleus were outclassed (34-29) by a great Danish team, which clinched an unprecedented third crown in a row. For Guillaume Gille's men, silver has a bitter taste, after a positive tournament.

entries.title: Erdogan says Turkey might approve Finland's NATO bid, block Sweden
entries.description: "If needed, we could give a different message about Finland. Sweden will be shocked when we give the different message about Finland," Erdogan said on Sunday.

entries.title: Renault to reduce stake in Nissan, rebalancing alliance
entries.description: The Japanese automaker said the new deal would "strengthen the ties of the alliance" which began in 1999 when Renault rescued Nissan from bankruptcy.

entries.title: Toyota top-selling automaker for third year running
entries.description: In 2022, Toyota sold 2.7 million electrified vehicles, around 5% more than the previous year.

entries.title: Major cocaine trafficking network goes on trial in the north of France
entries.description: Six men will be tried following an investigation launched in March 2017. In July of that year, 1,317 kg of cocaine was seized. The defendants face up to 30 years in prison.

entries.title: Big Tech in the US: 'The crisis will hit the wealthiest first'
entries.description: The stock market yo-yo experienced by the heavyweights of the new economy is due to the end of the free money policy implemented during Covid-19, explains 'Le Monde' New York correspondent Arnaud Leparmentier.

entries.title: Ukrainian Postal Service, a lifeline in a country at war
entries.description: As the main distributor of cash, Ukrposhta is the only public service present in the most remote – and sometimes, occupied – villages. Often criticized for its failures, the long-standing postal company today embodies the nation's spirit of resistance.

entries.title: Motown artist Barrett Strong dies at 81
entries.description: Barrett Strong was one of Motown's founding artists and songwriters. He sang lead on the company's breakthrough single 'Money (That's What I Want).' His death was announced Sunday.

entries.title: In a BBC documentary, Boris Johnson says that Vladimir Putin threatened him with a missile
entries.description: The apparent threat came in a phone call just ahead of the invasion on February 24, according to a new BBC documentary to be broadcast on Monday.

entries.title: Tennis: Victorious at the Australian Open, Novak Djokovic finds his throne and his salvation
entries.description: The Serbian won against Greece's Stefanos Tsitsipas on Sunday. It is his tenth title in Melbourne, his twenty-second Grand Slam, and he is back to being world's No. 1.

entries.title: Castilla y León, Spain's regional launch pad for the extreme right's culture wars
entries.description: The Vox party, a member of the conservative-led regional government, has an anti-abortion, anti-feminist discourse and is hostile to the central government's policy of transparency about the nation's fascist past.

entries.title: 'The climate benefits of 'carbon offsetting' are at best exaggerated, and at worst imaginary'
entries.description: 'Le Monde' columnist Stéphane Foucart explains how a survey conducted by several international media shows that the majority of carbon credits meant to compensate for greenhouse gas emissions do not lead to any climate benefit.
